subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Liverpool fans staged a protest during a Premier League match against West Ham on Wednesday, urging the club’s American owners to sell the team to a consortium from Dubai. Fans in the Kop — the area of the stadium filled with the most vocal supporters — stayed throughout halftime and chanted for the owners, Tom Hicks and George Gillett Jr., to sell. The two rejected an $800 million offer from Dubai International Capital this week. Fans are upset that Hicks and Gillett, who took charge last March, have saddled the club with debt, failed to start building a new stadium and sought to replace the popular coach Rafa Benítez.
